meanings.definition: Lying beneath or below something else.
meanings.sent1: The subjacent layer of soil provides support to the plants above.
meanings.sent2: The treasure chest was hidden in a subjacent cave.
meanings.sent3: The subjacent roots of the tree played hide and seek with the digging squirrel.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was like a subjacent river flowing silently beneath the surface.
meanings.sent5: The subjacent darkness of the ocean depths held many mysteries.

meanings.definition: Situated below or underneath something else.
meanings.sent1: The subjacent floor of the building housed the storage room.
meanings.sent2: The subjacent layer of paint was starting to peel off.
meanings.sent3: The subjacent cat found a cozy spot under the warm radiator.
meanings.sent4: His dreams were like subjacent clouds floating beneath the clear sky.
meanings.sent5: The subjacent roots of the old tree intertwined with the rocks below.
